Description: The boundary between clauses indicated by the presence of predicates and/or certain prosodic cues (e.g., head nod)
A first mention of an entity in a given discourse regardless of any syntactic role
A subject referent continued across two or more immediate clauses
A subject referent discontinued across at least one clause
A non-modified noun phrase (e.g., CAT, MOUSE)
A noun phrase modified by an index sign or an adjective
Borrowed nouns from Turkish spelled by the manual alphabet (e.g., K-E-D-İ ‘cat’)
An index sign used in isolation to refer to an entity in discourse
A manual construction that refers to the entirety of an entity
A manual construction that refers to a part of an entity
A manual construction that refers to the handling of an item
A manual construction that denotes the size and shape of an entity
A multifunctional construction where the signers take on the role of a referent and perform their actions
A verbal construction the beginning and ending of which agree with person and number
